page.title: 11King's School - Curriculum.
page.content: The majority of 'O' levels are taken after three years at the School, during which the subjects studied cover as broad a spectrum as possible. In the third and fourth forms, a variety of subjects are taught, including History, English, Latin, French, German, Mathematics. all the Sciences, Craft and Design. Some 'O' levels are taken early in the fourth form, but the majority are taken in the fifth form, where the top two forms take eight 'O' levels apiece and the lower two seven apiece. The 'A' level courses take two years and the majority of pupils study a combination of three 'A' levels. Furthermore, it is possible to study one-year subsidiary 'O' and 'AO' courses in the Lower Sixth, which include Astronomy, Computer Studies, and Geometrical and Engineering Design.
